content:
Your problem is https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1966256. The workaround is to change the UNC path you are using somewhere in Thunderbird to be a mapped drive.

Please confirm.
creator: wsmwk

content:
韋恩·梅里 said
您的問題是 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1966256。解決方法是將 Thunderbird 中某處使用的 UNC 路徑變更為映射磁碟機。請確認。

Thank you, Wayne.

Yes, that is indeed the issue. I appreciate your confirmation and the suggested workaround.

However, due to company policy and workflow requirements, we rely on opening .eml files directly from UNC paths and would prefer not to switch to mapped drives.

I hope this issue can be fully resolved in a future release so that Thunderbird continues to support UNC paths as in previous versions.

Thanks again for your help!

content:
Thunderbird now as two versions: the extended support release that is intended for long-term stability with minor updates, and the monthly release that will have the lastest enhancements. The version numbers are different, the esr is a t128 and the monthlly is at 138.

These links may help: 

 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel

https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/03/thunderbird-release-channel-update/

If you're happy with the ESR, just stay with it. I hope you find the links useful david

content: Spam filtering used to kick in during the initial mail check, not when the folder is viewed. Watching them vanish while you're reading is both weird and frustrating. Might be worth filing a bug report if one doesn’t already exist.

content: Bugzilla? It's hard to search for existing bug reports when the search terms are "junk" and "inbox." Been spending a little time each day looking, but it's slow going, heh.
creator: faruukie

content:
right click the folder, select properties and check that the folder is to be included when Thunderbird gets mail.

What you are describing sounds a little like what happens by default with SPAM/Junk folders as they are not polled for changes on a get mail only when selected. That same setting exists for all folders and default to check for everything but junk/spam and deleted/trash. The defaulting is set by a flag that also decides what "type" of folder it is and the icon it should have (junk, send etc)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Inbox doesn't have a checkbox for, "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder." The Junk folder does have that checkbox. It was not checked. It is checked now.

Junk emails are now eventually moved to the Junk folder. But it takes a minute.

Thunderbird will play the New Mail sound and pop up the notification. In the notification I can see that the email is spam. Instead of clicking on that Inbox, I'll wait a minute or two. After some time the spam is then moved to the Junk folder.

Unfortunately I still get the popup notification and the sound when spam arrives, because it initially sits in Inbox for a while.

I was unable to find anything similar on Bugzilla. I'm dragging my feet about submitting a bug report of my own.
creator: faruukie

content:
rUUk said
Inbox doesn't have a checkbox for, "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder." The Junk folder does have that checkbox. It was not checked. It is checked now. Junk emails are now eventually moved to the Junk folder. But it takes a minute. Thunderbird will play the New Mail sound and pop up the notification. In the notification I can see that the email is spam. Instead of clicking on that Inbox, I'll wait a minute or two. After some time the spam is then moved to the Junk folder. Unfortunately I still get the popup notification and the sound when spam arrives, because it initially sits in Inbox for a while.

This is a known issue.

rUUk said
I was unable to find anything similar on Bugzilla. I'm dragging my feet about submitting a bug report of my own.

That's OK. It could be a combination of issues.

Perhaps we try some things:

1. Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode Still In Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird. Does problem change?

2. Inbox - how big and how many messages?

3. What happens if you repair the Inbox, in Properties?

content: IMAP is a living account. The only way to stop is to either remove account or remove password so the signin gives regular 'incorrent password' message. If you want to keep the messages, but not the account, I suggest COPYing the messages to Local Folders and then close the account.

content:
In Tasto menu > Impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT cosa c'è nella casella Indirizzo per le risposte?

Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content:
Dato che usi Gmail con IMAP probabilmente hai sottoscritto la cartella Tutti i messaggi che contiene una copia della posta di tutte le altre cartelle. Di solito la sottrazione di questa cartella è sconsigliata proprio perché duplica la posta.

Qui trovi tutti i dettagli -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail#w_sottoscrizione-delle-cartelle-e-sincronizzazione-dei-messaggi

Prova a verificare se il problema è questo.

content: You could delete the user data by deleting the Thunderbird folder in .../AppData/Roaming, as this is unaffected by program uninstall/reinstall. A better method is to create a new profile, from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, which leaves the previous profile untouched in case it has data you wish to retain.

content:
I think the best you can achieve is the following:

1. Use "Multiweek" View in calendar.

2. Configure Multiweek View to show 6 weeks. Steps: "Settings" > "Calendar" > "Multiweek View" section > "Number of weeks to show (including previous weeks):" > "6 weeks".

3. If necessary, close Thunderbird, and then open Thunderbird again.

creator: 888dov

content:
Check folder retention policy

  • Right click on the subscribed gmail 'Sent Mail' folder and select 'Properties'
  • Select 'Retention Policy' tab
  • Usually the 'Use my account settings' option is selected.

What have you got selected ?

But then you need to check your account settings. 'Account Settings' select 'Synchronisation & Storage' for the gmail account

What is selected in that section ? Have you selected 'Keep messages in all folders.....' ? If you click on 'Advanced..' button - is the 'Sent Mail' folder selected ? Under 'Disc Space' : Is 'Synchronise all messages locally regardless of age' selected or something else ? Is 'Don't delete any messages' selected or something else?


Do you have any other means of accessing those emails, such as another laptop or maybe a phone, OR maybe even another email client on your computer which is operating in the background (I did come across someone who discovered they had Outlook still getting emails and it was causing a problem - they thought they had switched it off, but it was in the Startup list and unknowingly operating in the background) - because if you do then you need to check those devices and other email clients because if any of them delete a sent mail, it will get get deleted on server and then when Thunderbird imap Sent Mail folder synchronises with server it will also get updated to show what is on server.
